Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'What now if I were to disavow the fellow-monks?'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'What now if I were to disavow the novice?'?'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'What now if I were to disavow the preceptors of my equals?'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'What now if I were to disavow the teachers of my equals?'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'What now if I were to disavow the Brahma-life?'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

 

 

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'What now [44] if I were a householder?'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'What now if I were a lay-follower?'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'What now if I were a park-attendant?'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'What now if I were a novice?'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'What now if I were an adherent of another sect?'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'What now if I were a disciple of another sect?'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'What now if I were not a recluse?'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'What now if I were not a son of the Sakyans?'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

 

 

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were to disavow the enlightened one...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were to disavow dhamma...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were to disavow the Order...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were to disavow the training...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were to disavow the discipline...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were to disavow the Pāṭimokkha...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were to disavow the exposition...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were to disavow the preceptor...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were to disavow the teacher...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were to disavow the fellow-monks ...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were to disavow the novice...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were to disavow the preceptors of my equals...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were to disavow the teachers of my equals...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were to disavow the Brahma-life...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were a householder...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were a lay-follower...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were a park-attendant...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were a novice...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were an adherent of another sect...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were a disciple of another sect...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were not a recluse...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'But if I were not a son of the Sakyans...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

 

 

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'And I should disavow the enlightened one...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'And I should disavow dhamma...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'And I should disavow the Order...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'And I should disavow the teacher...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'And I should disavow the fellow-monk...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'And I should disavow the novice...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'And I should not be a lay-follower...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'And I should not be a park-attendant...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'And I should not be a novice...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'And I should not be an adherent of another sect...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'And I should not be a disciple of another sect...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'And I should not be a recluse...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'And I should not be a son of the Sakyans...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

 

 

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'Come now, I should disavow the enlightened one...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'Come now, I should disavow dhamma...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'Come now, I should disavow the Order...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

'Come now, I should disavow the training...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

'Come now, I should disavow the fellow-monks...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

'Come now, I should disavow the teachers of my equals...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'Come now, I should disavow the Brahma-life...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'Come now, I should not be a householder...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'Come now, I should not be a lay-follower...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'Come now, I should not be a park-attendant...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'Come now, I should not be a novice...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'Come now, I should not be an adherent of another sect...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'Come now, I should not be a disciple of another sect...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'Come now, I should not be a recluse...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'Come now, I should not be a son of the Sakyans...'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

 

 

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'The enlightened one is disavowed by me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'The dhamma is disavowed by me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'The Order is disavowed by me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'The training is disavowed by me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'The discipline is disavowed by me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'The Pāṭimokkha is disavowed by me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'The exposition is disavowed by me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'The preceptor is disavowed by me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'The teacher is disavowed by me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'The fellow-monks are disavowed by me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'The novice is disavowed by me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'The preceptors of my equals are disavowed by me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'The teachers of my equals are disavowed by me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'The Brahma-life is disavowed by me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'There is no existence as a householder for me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'There is no existence as a lay-follower for me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'There is no existence as a park-attendant for me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'There is no existence as a novice for me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'There is no existence as an adherent of another sect for me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'There is no existence as a disciple of another sect for me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'There is no existence as a recluse for me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'There is no existence as a son of the Sakyans for me.'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

 

 

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember my mother'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember my father'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember my brother'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember my sister'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember my son'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember my daughter'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember my wife'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember my relations'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember my friends'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember the village'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember the town'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember the rice-field'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember my property'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember my gold coins'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember my gold'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember my crafts'

Thus, monks, there is both a declaration of weakness and the training not disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I remember early laughter, prattle and amusement.'

Thus, monks, [25] there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

 

 

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have a mother, she ought to be supported by me.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have [45] a father, he ought to be supported by me.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have a brother, he ought to be supported by me.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have a sister, she ought to be supported by me.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have a son he ought to be supported by me.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have a daughter she ought to be supported by me.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have a wife she ought to be supported by me.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have relations, they ought to be supported by me.'

Thus, monks, [25] there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have friends, they ought to be supported by me.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

 

 

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have a mother, she will support me.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have a father, he will support me.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have friends, they will support me.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have a village, I will live by means of it.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have a town, I will live by means of it.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have rice-fields, I will live by means of it.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have property, I will live by means of it.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have gold coins, I will live by means of it.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I have gold, I will live by means of it.'

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

I have crafts, I will live by means of them.

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

 

 

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'This is difficult to do.

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'This is not easy to do.

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I am unable.

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I cannot endure

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I do not enjoy myself

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I take no delight.'[169]

Thus, monks, there is a declaration of weakness, the training not having been disavowed. [|2|]

 

 

And how, monks, is there a declaration of weakness with the training being disavowed?

Here, monks, a monk who is dissatisfied, chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I disavow the enlightened one.

This, monks, is a declaration of weakness and the training being disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I disavow the Dhamma.' [26]

This, monks, is a declaration of weakness and the training being disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I disavow the Order.'

This, monks, is a declaration of weakness and the training being disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I disavow the training.'

This, monks, is a declaration of weakness and the training being disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I disavow the discipline.'

This, monks, is a declaration of weakness and the training being disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I disavow the Pāṭimokkha.'

This, monks, is a declaration of weakness and the training being disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I disavow the exposition.'

This, monks, is a declaration of weakness and the training being disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I disavow the preceptor.'

This, monks, is a declaration of weakness and the training being disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I disavow the teacher.'

This, monks, is a declaration of weakness and the training being disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I disavow the fellow-monks.'

This, monks, is a declaration of weakness and the training being disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I disavow the novice.'

This, monks, is a declaration of weakness and the training being disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I disavow the preceptor of [46] my fellows.'

This, monks, is a declaration of weakness and the training being disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I disavow the teacher of my fellows.'

This, monks, is a declaration of weakness and the training being disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I disavow the Brahma-life.'

This, monks, is a declaration of weakness and the training being disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I will be a householder.'

This, monks, is a declaration of weakness and the training being disavowed.

Then further, a monk who is chafing, dissatisfied, desirous of passing from the state of a recluse, anxious, troubled and ashamed at being a monk, longing to be a householder, longing to be a lay-follower, longing to be a park-attendant, longing to be a novice, longing to belong to another sect, longing to be a disciple of another sect, longing not to be a recluse, longing not to be a son of the Sakyans, says and declares:

'I will be a lay-follower.'

This, monks, is a declaration of weakness and the training being disavowed.
