■

Opponents of monks, having brought a non-human eunuch drunk into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his rectum, the eunuch being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a non-human eunuch drunk into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his mouth, the eunuch being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a non-human eunuch dead but undecomposed into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his rectum, the eunuch being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

Opponents of monks, having brought a non-human eunuch dead and practically undecomposed into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his rectum, the eunuch being uncovered, the monk covered.

if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a non-human eunuch dead and practically decomposed into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his rectum, the eunuch being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

but agrees to withdraw,

agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a human male intoxicated into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his rectum, the human male being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a male animal into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his mouth, the male animal being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a male animal dead and practically decomposed into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his rectum, the eunuch being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

 

 

Covered/Covered

Opponents of monks, having brought a human woman into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with her rectum, the woman being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a human woman into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with her vagina, the woman being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a human woman drunk into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with her rectum, the woman being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,

Opponents of monks, having brought a non-human female dead but undecomposed into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with her vagina, the non-human female being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a non-human female dead but undecomposed into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with her mouth, the non-human female being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

but agrees to withdraw,

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a non-human female dead and practically decomposed into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with her rectum, the non-human female being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a female animal dead and practically decomposed into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with her rectum, the female animal being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a non-human hermaphrodite into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with her vagina, the hermaphrodite being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,

but agrees to withdraw,

but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

if he agrees to withdraw,

but agrees to withdraw,

and does not agree to remain,

agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a human eunuch mad into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his mouth, the eunuch being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought an animal eunuch asleep into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his rectum, the eunuch being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,

if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a non-human male into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his rectum, the non-human male being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a male animal dead but undecomposed into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his mouth, the male animal being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a male animal dead and practically decomposed into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his rectum, the eunuch being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

 

 

Uncovered/Uncovered

Opponents of monks, having brought a human woman into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with her rectum, the woman being uncovered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a human woman into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with her vagina, the woman being uncovered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a non-human female into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with her rectum, the non-human female being uncovered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

and does not agree to remain,

there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a female animal awake into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with her vagina, the female animal being uncovered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

there is an offence involving defeat.

and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,

but agrees to withdraw,

there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

Opponents of monks, having brought an animal hermaphrodite drunk into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with her vagina, the hermaphrodite being uncovered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought an animal hermaphrodite drunk into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with her mouth, the hermaphrodite being uncovered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought an animal hermaphrodite dead but undecomposed into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with her rectum, the hermaphrodite being uncovered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

agrees to withdraw,

and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought an animal hermaphrodite dead and practically decomposed into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with her rectum, the hermaphrodite being uncovered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,

and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,

and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,

but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,

but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,

and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a non-human eunuch awake into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his mouth, the eunuch being uncovered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

if he agrees to withdraw,

agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought an animal eunuch dead and practically decomposed into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his rectum, the eunuch being uncovered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a non-human male drunk into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his mouth, the non-human male being uncovered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a non-human male dead but undecomposed into a monk's presence, associate his male organ with his rectum, the non-human male being uncovered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

Covered/uncovered II

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a human woman, associate his male organ with her rectum, the woman being covered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a human woman, associate his male organ with her vagina, the woman being covered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a human woman, associate his male organ with her mouth, the woman being covered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a human woman asleep, associate his male organ with her vagina, the woman being covered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

if he agrees to remain,

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a non-human female mad, associate his male organ with her rectum, the non-human female being covered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a female animal drunk, associate his male organ with her vagina, the female animal being covered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a human hermaphrodite dead but undecomposed, associate his male organ with her mouth, the hermaphrodite being covered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,

agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,

but agrees to remain,

if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a non-human hermaphrodite dead and practically decomposed, associate his male organ with her rectum, the hermaphrodite being covered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a human eunuch, associate his male organ with his rectum, the eunuch being covered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a human eunuch, associate his male organ with his mouth, the eunuch being covered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,

agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a non-human eunuch dead and practically undecomposed, associate his male organ with his rectum, the eunuch being covered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

if he agrees to withdraw,

agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a human male drunk, associate his male organ with his rectum, the human male being covered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a male animal asleep, associate his male organ with his mouth, the male animal being covered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a male animal intoxicated, associate his male organ with his rectum, the male animal being covered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a male animal dead but undecomposed, associate his male organ with his rectum, the male animal being covered, the monk uncovered.

if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,

and does not agree to remain,

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a male animal dead and practically decomposed, associate his male organ with his rectum, the eunuch being covered, the monk uncovered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

 

 

Uncovered/Covered II

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into a human woman's presence, associate his male organ with her rectum, the woman being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into a human woman's presence, associate his male organ with her vagina, the woman being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,

but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a human woman dead but undecomposed, associate his male organ with her vagina, the woman being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

agrees to withdraw,

but agrees to remain,

and does not agree to withdraw,

there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a non-human female dead and practically undecomposed, associate his male organ with her mouth, the non-human female being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a non-human female dead and practically decomposed, associate his male organ with her rectum, the non-human female being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,

there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a human hermaphrodite, associate his male organ with her vagina, the hermaphrodite being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

agrees to withdraw,

but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a non-human hermaphrodite awake, associate his male organ with her mouth, the hermaphrodite being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought an animal hermaphrodite intoxicated, associate his male organ with her rectum, the hermaphrodite being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

if he agrees to withdraw,

but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a human eunuch dead but undecomposed, associate his male organ with his mouth, the eunuch being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,

there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought an animal eunuch mad, associate his male organ with his rectum, the eunuch being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a non-human male asleep, associate his male organ with his rectum, the non-human male being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a male animal dead and practically decomposed, associate his male organ with his mouth, the male animal being uncovered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is a grave offence.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

 

 

Covered/Covered II

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into a human woman's presence, associate his male organ with her rectum, the woman being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into a human woman's presence, associate his male organ with her vagina, the woman being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,

but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a non-human female awake, associate his male organ with her vagina, the non-human female being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

and does not agree to remain,

there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a female animal asleep, associate his male organ with her mouth, the female animal being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.

■

Opponents of monks, having brought a monk into the presence of a female animal intoxicated, associate his male organ with her rectum, the female animal being covered, the monk covered.

If he agrees to enter,
if he agrees to having entered,
if he agrees to remain,
if he agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
but agrees to having entered,
agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
but agrees to remain,
agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
but agrees to withdraw,
there is an offence involving defeat.

If he does not agree to enter,
and does not agree to having entered,
and does not agree to remain,
and does not agree to withdraw,
there is no offence.
